author: Jessica
title: Gen rec
question:
In our general recursion problems that produce images, I see that we have to code the exact base shape quite a few times.

Although this process is shorten in the check-expects using a local, I noticed that we don’t usually use it in the trivial answer when coding the function itself. 

Wouldn’t it be easier to define the basic shape as something at top level and use it throughout the problem. 

Example: 

(define STR0 (triangle s “outline” “red”) 

and use it everywhere in c.e. and fn 

I guessing that it would hinder readability but just want to ask for another explanation.
instructor_answer: The readability argument is the key point.  The examples are there first to help you understand the function and only later to serve as tests.  They tend to be more helpful for understanding if you write them out.
